intro: Caladenia arenicola, commonly known as the sandy orchid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, often colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, preferring arid or semi-arid environments. Its morphology includes a slender stem with a single or few flowers, each featuring a specialized lip that aids in pollination. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
